intro: Tropaeolum lasseri, commonly known as the Peruvian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Tropaeolaceae family, which includes several species of flowering plants known for their vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, colorful flowers that range from yellow to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often grown as an ornamental plant. Tropaeolum lasseri is also valued for its edible leaves, which have a slightly peppery taste similar to that of mustard.
